intro: Pithecellobium microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited acacia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, globose pods that contain several seeds. The plant is adapted to various soil types and can thrive in both dry and moist environments.
